page.title: 08SPRINGS
page.content: The local spring is near Hammerpot Inn, but springs are a common feature of this region. A spring is a name given to any natural outflow of water from rocks. They are commonly found where permeable rocks lie above an impermeable layer. In this area chalk downs lie to the North, and a clay lowland to the Southern coastal plain. The well jointed chalk is saturated to the level of the water-table and water, guided by joints, flows out at the junction with the impermeable clay rocks and runs down the hillside as a tiny stream. Springs commonly occur at the foot of the steep chalk slopes. Villages have grown up around these powerful springs and the line of villages sited at regular intervals along the scarfoot is known as spring-line settlement.
